name: Jquery-webglpanorama
body:
Easy-to-use jQuery plugin to display cube map panoramas on a HTML canvas object using WebGL. #### Downloads [production version][prod]
[development version][dev] [prod]: https://github.com/ulfbiallas/jquery-webglpanorama/raw/master/src/jquery-webglpanorama.min.js [dev]: https://github.com/ulfbiallas/jquery-webglpanorama/raw/master/src/jquery-webglpanorama.js ## How to use? All you need to use *WebGL Panorama* is a canvas object and a 360 degree panorama in shape of a cube map (consisting of 6 images) ```html ``` #### Optional parameters For the moment, there is just one optional parameter: ##### Field of view To set the field of view, just add the entry 'fov : someValue' to the parameter hash. If not explicitly set, it is set to its default value which is 90. ## Browser support Even if *WebGL Panorama* runs with every jQuery version, your browser has to support WebGL to work with it! ## License Copyright (c) 2014 Ulf Biallas. Licensed under the [MIT license][MIT]. [MIT]: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ulfbiallas/jquery-webglpanorama/master/LICENSE
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
